title: What you need to do to get your tax in before the deadline | ABC NEWS
description: The deadline for filing your tax return is nearly here - Friday 31 October. Make sure you get it done on time!   Video by Luke Radford. title: Criticism over PM's Joy Division T-shirt divides opposition | ABC NEWS
description: Sussan Ley has defended her criticism of the prime minister, claiming a Joy Division T-shirt he wore has antisemitic connotations. The Prime Minister was told about the origins of the name on a 2022 podcast. Nationals MPs have publicly declared they do not consider it worthy of criticism, with some Liberal MPs privately questioning the decision. title: Press taken inside Gaza by IDF for first time since ceasefire | ABC NEWS
description: The ABC was briefly taken inside Gaza for the first time since Israel and Hamas agree to a ceasefire two weeks ago.  No press are allowed to independently enter the strip, except in tightly controlled and highly choreographed "embeds" managed by the military.   There was no interaction with the Palestinian population during the ABC's visit and time on the ground was limited to about one hour.  ðŸ“¸ via ABC News by Middle East correspondent Matthew Doran + camera operator Hamish Harty   ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: UI design expert unpacks 'problematic' BOM website changes | ABC NEWS
description: The federal government has asked the Bureau of Meteorology to fix its new website after the changes were met with significant backlash from the public. Associate Professor Li Ping Thong, an expert in digital design, explains the shortfalls of the new website's navigation and information architecture. She says the Bureau should test future changes with a more diverse set of stakeholders to avoid disappointing certain power-user groups, such as farmers and regional Australians. title: Shark feeding frenzy caught at popular Queensland surf spot | ABC NEWS
description: Dozens of sharks have been spotted in a spectacular feeding frenzy at one of Queensland's most popular surf spots.  Onlookers captured these wild scenes at Snapper Rocks on the Gold Coast, as a pack of blacktip whaler sharks trapped a large school of bait fish.  Lifeguards closed the beach and surfers cleared the water watching on as the predators thrashed around in the shallows for hours.  Social version by Simon Greenfield for ABC News Digital. title: Hurricane Melissa makes landfall, destroys homes as Jamaica's strongest-ever storm | ABC NEWS
description: Hurricane Melissa made landfall in western Jamaica on Tuesday, local time. It has packed massive winds, weakening only slightly to 258kph and a category five storm as it crossed the coast. title: People are withdrawing their Super to pay for dental work more than ever | ABC NEWS
description: Experts are concerned Australians withdrew more than $817 million from their super for dental last financial year, compared to about $66 million in 2018-19. Some people who have raided their nest eggs for these procedures have been contacting the ABC to share horror stories, while others have said it has been life-changing. title: World leaders converge on South Korea for APEC Summit | ABC NEWS
description: 00:00 Donald Trump and China's President Xi Jinping are set to sit down for trade talks amid escalating tensions, with the US President "confident" of a positive outcome.  00:39 Anthony Albanese has joined world leaders, where much of the discussion has been around US tariffs and regional security. 02:20 North Asia Correspondent James Oaten takes a look at the expectations for the talks between Xi Jinping and Donald Trump. title: ABC taken into Gaza area under IDF control for first time since ceasefire | ABC NEWS
description: Israel has escorted a foreign media contingent into Gaza for the first time since the ceasefire with Hamas.  Hours later Israel launched strikes on Gaza City after Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu accused Hamas of violating the ceasefire agreement by attacking a soldier. Israel has also accused Hamas of staging efforts to reclaim the bodies of dead hostages. title: Perry Kouroumblis faces court over 1977 Easey St murders as committal hearing begins | ABC NEWS
description: Perry Kouroumblis, accused of committing Melbourne's gruesome Easey St murders, has appeared in court with a magistrate to decide whether there's enough evidence to take the matter to trial. The prosecution's case relies heavily on DNA evidence collected decades ago at the crime scene. Suzanne Armstrong and Susan Bartlett were stabbed to death in their Collingwood share house in 1977. title: Largest police operation in Rio de Janeiro turns deadly | The World | ABC NEWS
description: At least 64 people have been killed in a police operation targeting criminal networks in Brazil ahead of the United Nation's Climate Summit, COP30. The police raid is the largest and deadliest in Rio de Janeiro's history, withÂ more than 80 arrests made. As Amanda Robson reports, the disruptions have led to many locals worried about the violence. title: Storm chaser flies into the eye of Hurricane Melissa | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Hurricane Melissa is this year's strongest storm and the worst to ever hit Jamaica. The system has also made landfall in Cuba as a category three storm. Meteorologist Matthew Cappucci, who was a passenger on the 'Hurricane Hunter' flight that entered the eye of Melissa, tells The World it was a "sinisterly serene" scene. title: Ancient story that lives at the bottom of the ocean | Deep Time | ABC NEWS
description: At Murujuga in Western Australiaâ€™s Pilbara region, people hold a songline connected to land that is now underwater. The rock art all around here is like an encyclopedia into our nationâ€™s deep history, capturing life continuously over 50,000 years, including changes to the landscape. A deeply sacred place that visitors groups would travel to for important ceremony and law, the rock engravings passed down accumulated knowledge from one generation to the next for thousands of years.
